Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style patterned, pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black (partly worn); trace of single band in added white; exterior, slip worn, reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The number 25 is written on a paper label glued to the interior surface of the sherd and the same number is written in pencil on the exterior surface of the sherd. The lack of decoration on either side of the sherd may be a result of the sherd's size. The decoration on the exterior surface of Chalice Style vases (including patterned chalices) is not usually extensive.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0916) (phase 2)
